result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. Butzine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500+ costs = $1,158 , to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 1/31/16 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 24 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

received from the Defendant at the counter requesting help with his payment plan
Amended Time to Pay/Payment Extension Reminder

Case called at 10:33am [mo]
Defendant William J. Butzine in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Mr.Butzine waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Butzine

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500+ costs = $1,158 , to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 1/31/16 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 24 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibition warnings given
recess:11:04am

Case called at 2:30pm [mo]
Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV
Defendant William J. Butzine in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Lippert requests a Plea/Sentencing date.
--no objection from ADA Hall
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 2:45pm

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing on 12/28/15 at 10:00am

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:21 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant William J. Butzine in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Lippert submits substitution of Judge
ADA Fryatt presents case history and non-appearance. Requests bond be modified to $500 cash
Atty Lippert indicates that they will stipulate to $500 cash

Court adopts stipulation, modifies bond to $500 cash with same non-monetary conditions as previously set.
Court grants substitution of Judge, informs parties that matter will be assigned to Judge Koschnick
Court quashes warrant
Recess: 11:22 am 

NEXT: Schedule STC - 11/13/15 at 2:30 pm
Defendant made voluntary appearance // Duplicate Original Warrant returned by JCSD

Case called at 9:38am [mo]
Attorney Jordan Lippert in court.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, William Butzine does NOT appear.

DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance
The Court reviews the Court Record

Atty. Lippert indicates that he has had frequent communication with Mr. Butzine and expected him to appear today

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney/Assistant District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute/ADA Wambach did prosecute Mr. Butzine. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

The Court does find probable cause to exist within the Criminal Complaint 
DA Happ requests a bench warrant be issued.
The Court issues a bench warrant, body only.

recess: 9:47am
While processing the file it was found that the defendant was given a pre-trial date for a Sunday in error.  A new pre-trial date has been set and notices of hearings sent out.
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 8/21/15
Defendant in custody/Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD

Case called at 1:30pm [mo]
Defendant William J. Butzine appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Butzine is eligible for PD representation
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Butzine updates his address to Tratt St. in Whitewater, WI 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500  signature bond, with conditions:
--comply with all registry requirements
recess 1:34  pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/20/2015 at 9:00am   (2) Status Conference on 10/20/2015 at 9:30am
